thread.title: MWC 2017: nubia N1 Lite with 5.5-inch HD display, fingerprint sensor and 3,000mAh battery unveiled
thread.title_full: MWC 2017: nubia N1 Lite with 5.5-inch HD display, fingerprint sensor and 3,000mAh battery unveiled

title: MWC 2017: nubia N1 Lite with 5.5-inch HD display, fingerprint sensor and 3,000mAh battery unveiled
text:
MWC 2017: nubia N1 Lite with 5.5-inch HD display, fingerprint sensor and... MWC 2017: nubia N1 Lite with 5.5-inch HD display, fingerprint sensor and 3,000mAh battery unveiled By - February 28, 2017 “The nubia N1 Lite is a budget offering with a fingerprint sensor, 16GB of storage and a 3,000mAh battery” 
ZTE’s sub-brand nubia took the stage at MWC in Barcelona to introduce a new budget smartphone. Called the nubia N1 lite, the new device comes as a toned-down variant of the nubia N1 ( review ), which was launched last year. The budget offering features a rear-mounted fingerprint sensor, which is capable of unlocking the phone in 0.3 seconds. It can also be configured to unlock internal apps and sensitive documents. 
The nubia N1 Lite features a 5.5-inch HD IPS display, and boots Android 6.0 Marshmallow. The phone is powered by a quad-core 64-bit MediaTek SoC, mated to 2GB of RAM. There’s 16GB of internal memory on board, further expandable by inserting a microSD card. The camera department includes an 8MP rear snapper with a dual-LED flash and a 5MP front shooter with a single LED flash. The connectivity features include 4G LTE, dual-SIM slots, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.0 and GPS. A 3,000mAh battery keeps the phone running. 
The nubia N1 Lite has been priced at €159 (~Rs 11,500), and will go on sale in India, Germany, Spain, Italy, Czech Republic, Europe, Thailand, Vietnam and Indonesia soon. Facebook Comments
